page.title: 17RODMERSHAM CHURCH.
page.content: St Nicholas Church dates from Norman Times. We got into the church with a big iron key. The church has an Early Norman window. The Rood Screen is mainly Victorian but the 15th Century canopied Sedilia and Screen are made of chestnut. Between 1874 & 1896 there was much Victorian restoration. They copied a font but afterwards found the original one in someone's conservatory as a flowerpot. The 15th Century knapped flint Tower houses the belfry with 6 bells, with some hand bells in a cupboard. The steep spiral steps are key-shaped. When we got to the top we had a remarkable view; you could see Sheerness. The front of the graveyard is mown and the rest the sheep graze. In the graveyard there is a grave for 5 children who all died under the age of 6. There is a lych gate which has different religious quotations.
